alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 21 at 9:14PM CST until February 21 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST FOR NORTH CENTRAL BRYAN...SOUTHEASTERN COAL AND ATOKA COUNTIES... At 913 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Atoka to near Caney, moving east at 35 mph. Damaging winds are expected. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Caddo, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tushka, Caney, Lane, Daisy, Atoka Reservoir, Chockie, Bentley, McGee Creek Lake, Redden and Darwin. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are likely producing widespread wind damage near and east of Atoka and Caney. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
